Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a clear representation of two different types of habitats, including one land habitat and one water habitat.
The student can illustrate a variety of living things found in the land habitat, such as trees, grasses, and a selection of animals like lizards and squirrels.
The student can depict different living things found in the water habitat, including fish and some aquatic plants.
The student can show some differences in biodiversity by depicting a range of different living things in each habitat.
The student can indicate some patterns of plant and animal diversity across the two habitats, though they might not have detailed explanations or annotations.
CANNOT: The student might miss certain less obvious living things in each habitat, such as understory plants or insects. (student may not be aware of these or choose not to include them)
The student might have difficulty highlighting more complex diversity patterns, such as how specific adaptations suit the organisms to the habitat. (student only represents basic differences)
There may be some minor errors or omissions in labeling or depicting certain living things accurately. (student might forget or incorrectly identify an organism)
